programme.title: X-Men
X-Men
programme.desc:
X-Men: Directed by Bryan Singer. With Hugh Jackman, Patrick Stewart, Ian McKellen, Famke Janssen. In a world where mutants (evolved super-powered humans) exist and are discriminated against, two groups form for an inevitable clash: the supremacist Brotherhood, and the pacifist X-Men." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120903/","name":"X-Men","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmIyMDk5NGYtYjQ5NS00ZWQxLTg2YzQtZDk1ZmM4ZDBlN2E3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001772/","name":"Patrick Stewart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0413168/","name":"Hugh Jackman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005212/","name":"Ian McKellen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001741/","name":"Bryan Singer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0095134/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0001946/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0220892/","name":"Tom DeSanto"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001741/","name":"Bryan Singer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0371684/","name":"David Hayter"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi339519001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1ODQ1NjA0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDAxMDIyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1ODQ1NjA0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDAxMDIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two mutants come to a private academy for mutants whose resident superhero team must oppose a powerful mutant terrorist organization.
"},"datePublished":"2000-11-01","description":"In a world where mutants (evolved super-powered humans) exist and are discriminated against, two groups form for an inevitable clash: the supremacist Brotherhood, and the pacifist X-Men.","keywords":"mutant,superhero,superhero team,logan character,erik lehnsherr character","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120903/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Chiron1987"},"dateCreated":"2000-07-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Lee and Kirby's Finest Creation Comes to Life...","reviewBody":"The film version of Stan Lee and Jack "The King" Kirby's best-selling comic book creation, X-Men, has finally succeeded where more than twenty years of four-color, superhero movies have failed. They have finally got it right...

It is a stunning cinematic experience, faithfully adapting nearly 40 years of continuity into a stream-lined, fast-paced, wonderfully exciting trip into the legendary Marvel Universe. X-Men features incredible portrayals of much of the classic mutant cast, especially virtual unknown (at least here in the States) Hugh Jackman as Logan, the Canadian wildman we all know and love as Wolverine. Jackman seems born to play this coveted role with every bit of gruff and grim gusto; his Wolverine looks as if he simply stepped off one of Chris Claremont and John Byrne's exquisitely crafted pages. The rest of the cast was also pleasantly well-casted and well-suited for their roles, including the handsomely chisled James Marsden as the stoic field commander Cyclops and the gorgeous Anna Paquin as the can-never-touch-but-wish-we-all-could Rogue. Famke Janssen and Halle Berry are beautiful and bold as Jean Grey and Storm, respectively, not just appearing as fleeting shards of eye candy, but actually adding depth and strength to the flow of the film. Patrick Stewart's excellent Professor Charles Xavier is in fine Stewart fashion, extrapolating on his Jean-Luc Picard character, and adding genuine compassion and warmth.

Ian McKellan is superb as the tortured master of magnetism, Magneto, playing the part with malicious glee, tempered with an extreme form of jingoism for his cause of the militant uprising of mutants over "normal" people. His Brotherhood of (Evil) Mutants is composed of Sabretooth, viciously and animalistically portrayed Tyler Mane, The Phanton Menace's Ray Park is the wickedly amusing Toad, and the stunning Rebecca Romaijn-Stamos is the shape-shifter Mystique. Park actually had the most to say of Magneto's henchmen, but it was appropriate as these three comprise an awesomely evil team of muscle and not philosophy like their leader.

The productions values were spectacular, as were the settings, taking us from a stark, malign concentration camp in Poland to the wilds of the Canadian north to the serenity of Westchester, New York to a mind-bending climax on Liberty Island. The action sequences were well-paced and action-packed, and much more smoother and better choreographed than any of the Batman films. The special effects, especially Wolverine's legendary adamantium claws, were truly awe-inspiring.

X-Men was meticulously directed by Bryan Singer, who along with 20th Century Fox, actually listened to and cared about what X-Fans thought and wished to see on screen. Although we would have all liked to have stayed in that theater for another 95 minutes, there are many more stories to tell, and God willing, Fox will let it happen.

Most importantly, X-Men finally gives Marvel Entertainment Group a firm footing on film, a foundation that was never fully in its grasp until the surprise hit of two years ago, Blade. Now that Marvel has discovered that it can succeed with its top-tier characters, the sky is truly the limit for its varied cast of great characters. I hope that Warner Bros. will sit up and take notice at what X-Men has accomplished. Maybe this will be a wake-up call to those studio executives in charge of Superman and Batman, and make them realize that the fans' input really does count in the end...

Highest recommendation!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":581226,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

","datePublished":"2000-11-01","description":"In a world where mutants (evolved super-powered humans) exist and are discriminated against, two groups form for an inevitable clash: the supremacist Brotherhood, and the pacifist X-Men.","keywords":"mutant,superhero,superhero team,logan character,erik lehnsherr character","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120903/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Chiron1987","dateCreated":"2000-07-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Lee and Kirby's Finest Creation Comes to Life...","reviewBody":"The film version of Stan Lee and Jack "The King" Kirby's best-selling comic book creation, X-Men, has finally succeeded where more than twenty years of four-color, superhero movies have failed. They have finally got it right...

It is a stunning cinematic experience, faithfully adapting nearly 40 years of continuity into a stream-lined, fast-paced, wonderfully exciting trip into the legendary Marvel Universe. X-Men features incredible portrayals of much of the classic mutant cast, especially virtual unknown (at least here in the States) Hugh Jackman as Logan, the Canadian wildman we all know and love as Wolverine. Jackman seems born to play this coveted role with every bit of gruff and grim gusto; his Wolverine looks as if he simply stepped off one of Chris Claremont and John Byrne's exquisitely crafted pages. The rest of the cast was also pleasantly well-casted and well-suited for their roles, including the handsomely chisled James Marsden as the stoic field commander Cyclops and the gorgeous Anna Paquin as the can-never-touch-but-wish-we-all-could Rogue. Famke Janssen and Halle Berry are beautiful and bold as Jean Grey and Storm, respectively, not just appearing as fleeting shards of eye candy, but actually adding depth and strength to the flow of the film. Patrick Stewart's excellent Professor Charles Xavier is in fine Stewart fashion, extrapolating on his Jean-Luc Picard character, and adding genuine compassion and warmth.

Ian McKellan is superb as the tortured master of magnetism, Magneto, playing the part with malicious glee, tempered with an extreme form of jingoism for his cause of the militant uprising of mutants over "normal" people. His Brotherhood of (Evil) Mutants is composed of Sabretooth, viciously and animalistically portrayed Tyler Mane, The Phanton Menace's Ray Park is the wickedly amusing Toad, and the stunning Rebecca Romaijn-Stamos is the shape-shifter Mystique. Park actually had the most to say of Magneto's henchmen, but it was appropriate as these three comprise an awesomely evil team of muscle and not philosophy like their leader.

The productions values were spectacular, as were the settings, taking us from a stark, malign concentration camp in Poland to the wilds of the Canadian north to the serenity of Westchester, New York to a mind-bending climax on Liberty Island. The action sequences were well-paced and action-packed, and much more smoother and better choreographed than any of the Batman films. The special effects, especially Wolverine's legendary adamantium claws, were truly awe-inspiring.

X-Men was meticulously directed by Bryan Singer, who along with 20th Century Fox, actually listened to and cared about what X-Fans thought and wished to see on screen. Although we would have all liked to have stayed in that theater for another 95 minutes, there are many more stories to tell, and God willing, Fox will let it happen.

Most importantly, X-Men finally gives Marvel Entertainment Group a firm footing on film, a foundation that was never fully in its grasp until the surprise hit of two years ago, Blade. Now that Marvel has discovered that it can succeed with its top-tier characters, the sky is truly the limit for its varied cast of great characters. I hope that Warner Bros. will sit up and take notice at what X-Men has accomplished. Maybe this will be a wake-up call to those studio executives in charge of Superman and Batman, and make them realize that the fans' input really does count in the end...

Highest recommendation!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":581226,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4,"duration":"PT1H44M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Red Lights
Crvena svjetla
programme.desc:
Red Lights: Directed by Rodrigo Cortés. With Cillian Murphy, Sigourney Weaver, Robert De Niro, Toby Jones. Psychologist Margaret Matheson and her assistant study paranormal activity, which leads them to investigate a world-renowned psychic who has resurfaced years after his toughest critic mysteriously passed away." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1748179/","name":"Red Lights","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQzMjYwNTc2M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTY0Mjc4Nw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000244/","name":"Sigourney Weaver"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0614165/","name":"Cillian Murphy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0181579/","name":"Rodrigo Cortés"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002572/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0094925/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011291/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0181579/","name":"Rodrigo Cortés"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3842417177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQ4NzcyNTYwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTc5ODg4MjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQ4NzcyNTYwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTc5ODg4MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Psychologist Margaret Matheson and her assistant study paranormal activity, which leads them to investigate a world-renowned psychic who has resurfaced years after his toughest critic mysteriously passed away. "},"datePublished":"2012-03-02","description":"Psychologist Margaret Matheson and her assistant study paranormal activity, which leads them to investigate a world-renowned psychic who has resurfaced years after his toughest critic mysteriously passed away.","keywords":"psychic,revelation,obsession,younger version of character,road trip","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1748179/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BharatSamra"},"dateCreated":"2012-07-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"1/2","reviewBody":"Not very often do you see such juxtaposition in film in terms of narrative structure. Unfortunately the second hour of this ambitious thriller fails to follow its enthralling predecessor, which explores a new and engaging concept. 

Following in the footsteps of the director, why not separate my review into two halves? Though I will try not to decline in the quality of analysis.

With a highly respected and frankly quite surprising cast (the surprise being the lack of marketing and attention the film has received), nothing negative can be said of the fine performances, most notably from our protagonist Cillian Murphy. The actors deliver dialogue to assist the slow plot development and at times subtle, appropriate humour between Murphy and Sigourney Weaver's characters. The chemistry between the two paranormal researchers is evident throughout and it is not until one of the film's many expositions where this is lost. This technique of continuous revelations is what enables an audience to remain in their seats despite having perhaps consumed too much of the overpriced beverages from the lobby, and as cliché as it is, keeps you on the edge of your seat. (hopefully not due to irritability) The script itself unveils an original idea of exposing paranormal phenomena as fraudulent, which itself is reason enough to enjoy this film in theatres while you still can!

Now onto the second hour, I mean paragraph. The immediate impact of the arguably primary disequilibrium can be felt as it occurs, as the tone of the motion picture changes. Unexpected plot holes begin to expose themselves as spots might to a thirteen year-old. This unfortunate turn in events (speaking both figuratively and literally) proves to lead to an eventual anti-climax, that cannot be described as anything else but disappointing. As a consumer, I found myself questioning where exactly the film was going, as one might if taken on a different bus route to a usually predictable destination. Though we ended up at the expectation of predictability and disappointment. (only an expectation in hour two) Anticipating the final exposition was a task of its own, would there be a resolution? Would our unusual tragic hero achieve his goal? How would a new equilibrium be incorporated? This is what kept blinking to a minimum throughout, though eyes were still rolling at particular moments due to the inconceivable mistakes and unexplained occurrences. We were almost being rushed towards the end of the story so that the theatre could get more people to enjoy the film for an hour or tw... forget it, just the one hour.

Without the cast to save the ambition and potential of Rodrigo Cortes' piece, it no doubt would have been a disaster in all respects and its already mundane box office performance would be as low as my mood coming out of Screen 14 last Wednesday. With all respect to the director/writer though, 'Red Lights' is worth watching based solely on the first 60 minutes because of the idea, as well as the performances of the many talented actors, despite some characters being completely irrelevant and unnecessary. If you find yourself searching for something to do one evening, and if there are no particular films you desire to see, but you desire to see a film then 'Red Lights' will moderately satisfy your appetite, though you may be disappointed there wasn't more on the plate.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":59413,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

","datePublished":"2012-03-02","description":"Psychologist Margaret Matheson and her assistant study paranormal activity, which leads them to investigate a world-renowned psychic who has resurfaced years after his toughest critic mysteriously passed away.","keywords":"psychic,revelation,obsession,younger version of character,road trip","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1748179/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"BharatSamra","dateCreated":"2012-07-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"1/2","reviewBody":"Not very often do you see such juxtaposition in film in terms of narrative structure. Unfortunately the second hour of this ambitious thriller fails to follow its enthralling predecessor, which explores a new and engaging concept. 

Following in the footsteps of the director, why not separate my review into two halves? Though I will try not to decline in the quality of analysis.

With a highly respected and frankly quite surprising cast (the surprise being the lack of marketing and attention the film has received), nothing negative can be said of the fine performances, most notably from our protagonist Cillian Murphy. The actors deliver dialogue to assist the slow plot development and at times subtle, appropriate humour between Murphy and Sigourney Weaver's characters. The chemistry between the two paranormal researchers is evident throughout and it is not until one of the film's many expositions where this is lost. This technique of continuous revelations is what enables an audience to remain in their seats despite having perhaps consumed too much of the overpriced beverages from the lobby, and as cliché as it is, keeps you on the edge of your seat. (hopefully not due to irritability) The script itself unveils an original idea of exposing paranormal phenomena as fraudulent, which itself is reason enough to enjoy this film in theatres while you still can!

Now onto the second hour, I mean paragraph. The immediate impact of the arguably primary disequilibrium can be felt as it occurs, as the tone of the motion picture changes. Unexpected plot holes begin to expose themselves as spots might to a thirteen year-old. This unfortunate turn in events (speaking both figuratively and literally) proves to lead to an eventual anti-climax, that cannot be described as anything else but disappointing. As a consumer, I found myself questioning where exactly the film was going, as one might if taken on a different bus route to a usually predictable destination. Though we ended up at the expectation of predictability and disappointment. (only an expectation in hour two) Anticipating the final exposition was a task of its own, would there be a resolution? Would our unusual tragic hero achieve his goal? How would a new equilibrium be incorporated? This is what kept blinking to a minimum throughout, though eyes were still rolling at particular moments due to the inconceivable mistakes and unexplained occurrences. We were almost being rushed towards the end of the story so that the theatre could get more people to enjoy the film for an hour or tw... forget it, just the one hour.

Without the cast to save the ambition and potential of Rodrigo Cortes' piece, it no doubt would have been a disaster in all respects and its already mundane box office performance would be as low as my mood coming out of Screen 14 last Wednesday. With all respect to the director/writer though, 'Red Lights' is worth watching based solely on the first 60 minutes because of the idea, as well as the performances of the many talented actors, despite some characters being completely irrelevant and unnecessary. If you find yourself searching for something to do one evening, and if there are no particular films you desire to see, but you desire to see a film then 'Red Lights' will moderately satisfy your appetite, though you may be disappointed there wasn't more on the plate.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":59413,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"duration":"PT1H54M"</script><metacontent="

Charles Dexter Ward's wife enlists the help of a private detective to find out what her husband is up to in a remote cabin owned by his family for centuries." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105242/","name":"The Resurrected","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGMyMmVjZGQtZDVkMS00NmQ5LWIxMDgtZTU3MzkzNjVlOGI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0856012/","name":"John Terry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0796235/","name":"Jane Sibbett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001697/","name":"Chris Sarandon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0639321/","name":"Dan O'Bannon"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042556/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0157793/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0640217/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0522454/","name":"H.P. Lovecraft"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0295165/","name":"Brent V. Friedman"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Resurrected","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi813023001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzFhNmRlZTctZDhmNS00MzNlLWJhOWYtNTY4ZWU1MmJlODg1XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzFhNmRlZTctZDhmNS00MzNlLWJhOWYtNTY4ZWU1MmJlODg1XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"datePublished":"1993-03-26","description":"Charles Dexter Ward's wife enlists the help of a private detective to find out what her husband is up to in a remote cabin owned by his family for centuries.","keywords":"psychotronic film,remake,based on the works of h.p. lovecraft,two word title,body horror","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105242/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"The_Void"},"dateCreated":"2006-06-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"An excellent adaptation of a classic Lovecraft tale!","reviewBody":"The nineties were a disappointing decade for the horror genre whichever way you look at it, so it's lucky that filmmakers like Stuart Gordon and Dan O'Bannon were on hand to adapt classic HP Lovecraft stories. Horror fans have got used to seeing a director's credit for the aforementioned Stuart Gordon and a starring role for the great Jeffrey Combs in Lovecraft films; but even though this one has neither, director Dan O'Bannon has succeeded in brining the classic "The Case of Charles Dexter Ward" to screen. Of course, this isn't the first screen adaptation of the classic story; as Roger Corman made a rather good one in 1963 with the classic 'The Haunted Palace'. The plot has shades of Re-Animator, and follows an investigation into a man who may have found a way to cheat death. The story starts when Charles Dexter Ward's wife visits a private detective, asking him to investigate her husband who has become a recluse; living in a house on their estate grounds. A strange smell of death permeates the air surrounding the retreat, and the neighbours are suspicious after seeing the amount of raw meat being delivered...\n\nThe film doesn't contain a great deal of suspense, but the director masks this nicely with a great aura of mystery and intrigue. The film builds up to finally discovering the mystery behind what Charles Dexter Ward has been doing, and although it takes a while to get there - the film never gets boring because O'Bannon keeps the mystery bubbling. The special effects are a little silly, but they actually work quite well in the context of the film, and O'Bannon gets to show his twisted imagination with abominations such as a still-living mauled torso and many other otherworldly creatures. There's a lot of blood and guts too, and even though the film appears to be trying to imitate A-class horror, O'Bannon doesn't completely veer away from B-movie cinema. The acting is decent enough, but one of the few weak links for me. John Terry is more than a little unenthusiastic, while Chris Sarandon never completely convinces in the Vincent Price role of the villain. That really isn't important, however, as it's the atmosphere and the story that are the stars of the show here - and The Resurrected is strong in both those areas. This film is indeed a lost gem and one that deserves to be more seen!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3932,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

Horror fans have got used to seeing a director's credit for the aforementioned Stuart Gordon and a starring role for the great Jeffrey Combs in Lovecraft films; but even though this one has neither, director Dan O'Bannon has succeeded in brining the classic "The Case of Charles Dexter Ward" to screen. Of course, this isn't the first screen adaptation of the classic story; as Roger Corman made a rather good one in 1963 with the classic 'The Haunted Palace'. The plot has shades of Re-Animator, and follows an investigation into a man who may have found a way to cheat death. The story starts when Charles Dexter Ward's wife visits a private detective, asking him to investigate her husband who has become a recluse; living in a house on their estate grounds. A strange smell of death permeates the air surrounding the retreat, and the neighbours are suspicious after seeing the amount of raw meat being delivered...\n\nThe film doesn't contain a great deal of suspense, but the director masks this nicely with a great aura of mystery and intrigue. The film builds up to finally discovering the mystery behind what Charles Dexter Ward has been doing, and although it takes a while to get there - the film never gets boring because O'Bannon keeps the mystery bubbling. The special effects are a little silly, but they actually work quite well in the context of the film, and O'Bannon gets to show his twisted imagination with abominations such as a still-living mauled torso and many other otherworldly creatures. There's a lot of blood and guts too, and even though the film appears to be trying to imitate A-class horror, O'Bannon doesn't completely veer away from B-movie cinema. The acting is decent enough, but one of the few weak links for me. John Terry is more than a little unenthusiastic, while Chris Sarandon never completely convinces in the Vincent Price role of the villain. That really isn't important, however, as it's the atmosphere and the story that are the stars of the show here - and The Resurrected is strong in both those areas. This film is indeed a lost gem and one that deserves to be more seen!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3932,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3,"duration":"PT1H48M"</script><metacontent="

Friedman"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Resurrected","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi813023001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzFhNmRlZTctZDhmNS00MzNlLWJhOWYtNTY4ZWU1MmJlODg1XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzFhNmRlZTctZDhmNS00MzNlLWJhOWYtNTY4ZWU1MmJlODg1XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"datePublished":"1993-03-26","description":"Charles Dexter Ward's wife enlists the help of a private detective to find out what her husband is up to in a remote cabin owned by his family for centuries.","keywords":"psychotronic film,remake,based on the works of h.p. lovecraft,two word title,body horror","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105242/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"The_Void"},"dateCreated":"2006-06-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"An excellent adaptation of a classic Lovecraft tale!","reviewBody":"The nineties were a disappointing decade for the horror genre whichever way you look at it, so it's lucky that filmmakers like Stuart Gordon and Dan O'Bannon were on hand to adapt classic HP Lovecraft stories. Horror fans have got used to seeing a director's credit for the aforementioned Stuart Gordon and a starring role for the great Jeffrey Combs in Lovecraft films; but even though this one has neither, director Dan O'Bannon has succeeded in brining the classic "The Case of Charles Dexter Ward" to screen. Of course, this isn't the first screen adaptation of the classic story; as Roger Corman made a rather good one in 1963 with the classic 'The Haunted Palace'. The plot has shades of Re-Animator, and follows an investigation into a man who may have found a way to cheat death. The story starts when Charles Dexter Ward's wife visits a private detective, asking him to investigate her husband who has become a recluse; living in a house on their estate grounds. A strange smell of death permeates the air surrounding the retreat, and the neighbours are suspicious after seeing the amount of raw meat being delivered...\n\nThe film doesn't contain a great deal of suspense, but the director masks this nicely with a great aura of mystery and intrigue. The film builds up to finally discovering the mystery behind what Charles Dexter Ward has been doing, and although it takes a while to get there - the film never gets boring because O'Bannon keeps the mystery bubbling. The special effects are a little silly, but they actually work quite well in the context of the film, and O'Bannon gets to show his twisted imagination with abominations such as a still-living mauled torso and many other otherworldly creatures. There's a lot of blood and guts too, and even though the film appears to be trying to imitate A-class horror, O'Bannon doesn't completely veer away from B-movie cinema. The acting is decent enough, but one of the few weak links for me. John Terry is more than a little unenthusiastic, while Chris Sarandon never completely convinces in the Vincent Price role of the villain. That really isn't important, however, as it's the atmosphere and the story that are the stars of the show here - and The Resurrected is strong in both those areas. This film is indeed a lost gem and one that deserves to be more seen!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3932,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

Horror fans have got used to seeing a director's credit for the aforementioned Stuart Gordon and a starring role for the great Jeffrey Combs in Lovecraft films; but even though this one has neither, director Dan O'Bannon has succeeded in brining the classic "The Case of Charles Dexter Ward" to screen. Of course, this isn't the first screen adaptation of the classic story; as Roger Corman made a rather good one in 1963 with the classic 'The Haunted Palace'. The plot has shades of Re-Animator, and follows an investigation into a man who may have found a way to cheat death. The story starts when Charles Dexter Ward's wife visits a private detective, asking him to investigate her husband who has become a recluse; living in a house on their estate grounds. A strange smell of death permeates the air surrounding the retreat, and the neighbours are suspicious after seeing the amount of raw meat being delivered...\n\nThe film doesn't contain a great deal of suspense, but the director masks this nicely with a great aura of mystery and intrigue. The film builds up to finally discovering the mystery behind what Charles Dexter Ward has been doing, and although it takes a while to get there - the film never gets boring because O'Bannon keeps the mystery bubbling. The special effects are a little silly, but they actually work quite well in the context of the film, and O'Bannon gets to show his twisted imagination with abominations such as a still-living mauled torso and many other otherworldly creatures. There's a lot of blood and guts too, and even though the film appears to be trying to imitate A-class horror, O'Bannon doesn't completely veer away from B-movie cinema. The acting is decent enough, but one of the few weak links for me. programme.title: Red Lights
Crvena svjetla
programme.desc:
Red Lights: Directed by Rodrigo Cortés. With Cillian Murphy, Sigourney Weaver, Robert De Niro, Toby Jones. Psychologist Margaret Matheson and her assistant study paranormal activity, which leads them to investigate a world-renowned psychic who has resurfaced years after his toughest critic mysteriously passed away." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1748179/","name":"Red Lights","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQzMjYwNTc2M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTY0Mjc4Nw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000244/","name":"Sigourney Weaver"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0614165/","name":"Cillian Murphy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0181579/","name":"Rodrigo Cortés"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002572/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0094925/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011291/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0181579/","name":"Rodrigo Cortés"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3842417177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQ4NzcyNTYwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTc5ODg4MjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQ4NzcyNTYwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTc5ODg4MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Psychologist Margaret Matheson and her assistant study paranormal activity, which leads them to investigate a world-renowned psychic who has resurfaced years after his toughest critic mysteriously passed away. "},"datePublished":"2012-03-02","description":"Psychologist Margaret Matheson and her assistant study paranormal activity, which leads them to investigate a world-renowned psychic who has resurfaced years after his toughest critic mysteriously passed away.","keywords":"psychic,revelation,obsession,younger version of character,road trip","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1748179/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BharatSamra"},"dateCreated":"2012-07-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"1/2","reviewBody":"Not very often do you see such juxtaposition in film in terms of narrative structure. Unfortunately the second hour of this ambitious thriller fails to follow its enthralling predecessor, which explores a new and engaging concept. 

Following in the footsteps of the director, why not separate my review into two halves? Though I will try not to decline in the quality of analysis.

With a highly respected and frankly quite surprising cast (the surprise being the lack of marketing and attention the film has received), nothing negative can be said of the fine performances, most notably from our protagonist Cillian Murphy. The actors deliver dialogue to assist the slow plot development and at times subtle, appropriate humour between Murphy and Sigourney Weaver's characters. The chemistry between the two paranormal researchers is evident throughout and it is not until one of the film's many expositions where this is lost. This technique of continuous revelations is what enables an audience to remain in their seats despite having perhaps consumed too much of the overpriced beverages from the lobby, and as cliché as it is, keeps you on the edge of your seat. (hopefully not due to irritability) The script itself unveils an original idea of exposing paranormal phenomena as fraudulent, which itself is reason enough to enjoy this film in theatres while you still can!

Now onto the second hour, I mean paragraph. The immediate impact of the arguably primary disequilibrium can be felt as it occurs, as the tone of the motion picture changes. Unexpected plot holes begin to expose themselves as spots might to a thirteen year-old. This unfortunate turn in events (speaking both figuratively and literally) proves to lead to an eventual anti-climax, that cannot be described as anything else but disappointing. As a consumer, I found myself questioning where exactly the film was going, as one might if taken on a different bus route to a usually predictable destination. Though we ended up at the expectation of predictability and disappointment. (only an expectation in hour two) Anticipating the final exposition was a task of its own, would there be a resolution? Would our unusual tragic hero achieve his goal? How would a new equilibrium be incorporated? This is what kept blinking to a minimum throughout, though eyes were still rolling at particular moments due to the inconceivable mistakes and unexplained occurrences. We were almost being rushed towards the end of the story so that the theatre could get more people to enjoy the film for an hour or tw... forget it, just the one hour.

Without the cast to save the ambition and potential of Rodrigo Cortes' piece, it no doubt would have been a disaster in all respects and its already mundane box office performance would be as low as my mood coming out of Screen 14 last Wednesday. With all respect to the director/writer though, 'Red Lights' is worth watching based solely on the first 60 minutes because of the idea, as well as the performances of the many talented actors, despite some characters being completely irrelevant and unnecessary. If you find yourself searching for something to do one evening, and if there are no particular films you desire to see, but you desire to see a film then 'Red Lights' will moderately satisfy your appetite, though you may be disappointed there wasn't more on the plate.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":59413,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Wicker Man
The Wicker Man
programme.desc: The Wicker Man: Directed by Robin Hardy. With Edward Woodward, Christopher Lee, Diane Cilento, Britt Ekland. A puritan Police Sergeant arrives in a Scottish island village in search of a missing girl whom the locals claim never existed." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0070917/","name":"The Wicker Man","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWIzY2QyNDQtOWI3Ni00MjEwLTlhYTgtZTgyMThiY2JkMTY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0940919/","name":"Edward Woodward"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000489/","name":"Christopher Lee"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0162283/","name":"Diane Cilento"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0362736/","name":"Robin Hardy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103038/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0787289/","name":"Anthony Shaffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0684432/","name":"David Pinner"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Wicker Man: The Final Cut","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi695053849","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlZmZmOTEtYTc4YS00N2VlLWI2MjUtNGZiYjQzMDJjODNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlZmZmOTEtYTc4YS00N2VlLWI2MjUtNGZiYjQzMDJjODNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for The Wicker Man: The Final Cut"},"datePublished":"1973-12-06","description":"A puritan Police Sergeant arrives in a Scottish island village in search of a missing girl whom the locals claim never existed.","keywords":"paganism,religious sacrifice,folk horror,ritual killing,paganism vs. christianity","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0070917/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Infofreak"},"dateCreated":"2003-08-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"The most original and haunting British horror movie EVER. Fascinating, chilling, and utterly unique.","reviewBody":"I've been fascinated by 'The Wicker Man' ever since I first saw it on TV in the late 1970s. I was very young then and probably didn't completely understand it, but I knew immediately that it was a very special movie, unlike anything I'd ever seen before. Twenty five years, and literally thousands of movies later, I think even more highly of it, especially now that I'm able to see the cut available on the 30th Anniversary DVD, which is over fifteen minutes longer than the version I already own on video. And, yes, 'The Wicker Man' is still unlike any other movie I've ever seen. I think this is mainly down to the brilliant script by Anthony Shaffer, who also wrote 'Sleuth' and Hitchcock's 'Frenzy'. There hasn't been anything made remotely like it since. I think it's the greatest British horror movie ever made, but the description "horror" only gives you half the story. It's also a thriller, a mystery, a Christian morality tale, and in a weird way, a musical. Christopher Lee regards it as the best movie he's ever been involved with, and describes it as one of the three or four greatest movies ever made in Britain, and I agree with him. Lee is very good in the movie as the enigmatic Lord Summerisle, but Edward Woodward is the real star. Woodward is best know for his TV work, as either 'Callan' or 'The Equalizer', depending what generation you're from, but he's superb as the deeply religious Sgt. Howie. Apparently Peter Cushing was initially suggested for the role, as was Michael York, but I really can't imagine either of then being half as good as Woodward is. The supporting cast are all superb - Diane Cilento as the school teacher, famous mime Lindsay Kemp as the publican, and especially Britt Ekland as the publican's daughter Willow. Ekland's seduction dance scene is the second most famous scene in the movie. She claims her speaking voice was dubbed throughout , director Robin Hardy disputes this, though her singing voice certainly was, and she used a (ahem) butt double. I also get a kick out of Aubrey Morris' graveyard scene. Morris is a great Brit character actor and was also in 'A Clockwork Orange', Hammer's 'Blood From The Mummy's Tomb' and sci fi trash classic 'Lifeforce'. Another Hammer alumni Ingrid Pitt ('The Vampire Lovers', 'Countess Dracula', etc.) is also in the cast as a librarian, but sadly in underused. Still, I'm glad she was involved. Inexplicably some people seem to hate this movie. I can't for the life of me understand why. It's utterly brilliant, utterly unique, and I never tire of watching it. If you've never seen it before I envy you! It's a cliche, but believe me, you have never seen anything like it before!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":72818,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:

A group of Confederate soldiers hole up in an abandoned plantation after robbing a bank and find themselves at the mercy of supernatural forces." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0377749/","name":"Dead Birds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2VkNWFkMmItOGU1ZC00NDJiLWE3ZWQtZjA3MDJjMmMzYmE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Thriller","Western"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001794/","name":"Henry Thomas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0297578/","name":"Patrick Fugit"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0043704/","name":"Nicki Aycox"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0877366/","name":"Alex Turner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113121/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0109439/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1440023/","name":"Simon Barrett"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Dead Birds","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi161546521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWNhMDhhZTQtMjY0NS00YmNjLTkyNWEtZjhlYTVmMDkxZDFkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWNhMDhhZTQtMjY0NS00YmNjLTkyNWEtZjhlYTVmMDkxZDFkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"datePublished":"2004-09-13","description":"A group of Confederate soldiers hole up in an abandoned plantation after robbing a bank and find themselves at the mercy of supernatural forces.","keywords":"demon,19th century,black magic,bank robbery,horror western","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0377749/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"senschick"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fly to see Dead Birds","reviewBody":"I thought the pacing was excellent! I was hooked from the very beginning when the first possie of soldiers road into town.

Really great. Ominous. The music was fantastic. So much so that I wanted a mute button because it got me shaking in my seat. The acting was strong - I had a soft spot for Michael Shannon - he has a Christopher Walkeness about him:) I have to tell you that I hid my eyes every time the music reved up for a "BOO" moment so I didn't see all the special effects!!! 

I was with a friend who is a big horror fan and he said that he really enjoyed it.

So would I tell my friends to see this movie? the ones that I know are Thriller/horror fans YES!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":10008,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Sentinel
Stražar
programme.desc:
The Sentinel: Directed by Michael Winner. With Chris Sarandon, Cristina Raines, Martin Balsam, John Carradine. A young woman moves into an apartment in a building which houses a sinister evil." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0076683/","name":"The Sentinel","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmRhMjJhOWQtNTE0ZS00YTc5LWE5YzUtZTkwZDEyNTE4MTY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0707043/","name":"Cristina Raines"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001257/","name":"Ava Gardner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001697/","name":"Chris Sarandon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0935382/","name":"Michael Winner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0085614/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0465458/","name":"Jeffrey Konvitz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0935382/","name":"Michael Winner"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Sentinel","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3096559385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjZmMTQyYTMtYzc5Yy00ZGUzLTlhYTItY2ViZGVkM2EyZjE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjZmMTQyYTMtYzc5Yy00ZGUzLTlhYTItY2ViZGVkM2EyZjE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"datePublished":"1977-02-11","description":"A young woman moves into an apartment in a building which houses a sinister evil.","keywords":"palace,psychotronic film,downward spiral,supernatural horror,slasher","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0076683/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MarieGabrielle"},"dateCreated":"2006-01-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"See this movie on Halloween......","reviewBody":"No, this is not a great movie. But I give the casting director extra stars for the cast, Ava Gardner, Eli Wallach, Chris Sarandon, John Carradine, Burgess Meredith, a very young Christopher Walken (he was quite handsome then), Beverly D'Ángelo, and Jerry Orbach, among others.

The film quality of the 70's adds that special touch, the chrome, shag rugs and gaudy artwork. The apartment Cristina Raines rents for $400.00 per month would probably cost $7000.00 now, so it is fun to see Brooklyn Heights, and days when New York was a little cleaner, filmed during the turbulent 70's when we had Son of Sam, movies like the Exorcist, Amityville Horror, Helter Skelter, and the like.

I am not sure if this is a pro-Catholic film, as one reviewer said. The church is certainly portrayed as Cristina Raines' only salvation; I will have to read the book to see if that is the case.

At any rate, you will enjoy parts of this movie. Beverly D'Angelo is quite strange, Cristina Raines is believable, the scary scenes are a little weird, but if you are up for it, this is an okay movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9432,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Brooklyn 99
programme.desc: Zakon i nered. U njujorškoj policijskoj postaji u Brooklynu svaki dan je poseban, svaki je drugačiji i u pravilu prilično kaotičan. Jake Peralta (Andy Samberg) talentirani je detektiv, zbog čega se nikad nije morao ubijati od posla i slijepo se držati pravila. Budući da je uhitio više zločinaca od kolega, tijekom karijere svi su ga držali kao kap vode na dlanu. Sve dok u postaju nije došao novi zapovjednik, kapetan Ray Holt (Andre Braugher). Kapetan Holt poštuje pravila i propise, koje su detektivi 99. postaje dugo zanemarivali. Jakeovi kolege vrsni su i sposobni detektivi, ali kronično im nedostaje reda i discipline. Međusobno se nadmeću, idu si na živce, tračaju i flertaju, ali u konačnici jedni druge štite. Detektivka Amy Santiago (Melissa Fumero), dežurna čistunka u postaji, oduševljena je novim vodstvom. Budući da je odrasla sa sedmoricom braće, voli se nadmetati u svakom smislu te riječi. Silno želi uhititi više zločinaca od Jakea i svjesna je koliko se mora potruditi da bi u tome uspjela. Holtov zamjenik, narednik Terry Jeffords (Terry Crews), stijena je od čovjeka, no povukao se u ured nakon što mu je žena rodila blizanke Cagney i Lacey, i to zbog silnoga straha da u suprotnome neće vidjeti kako mu kćeri odrastaju. U 99. postaji radi i detektiv Charles Boyle (Joe Lo Truglio), kojem je Jake idol. Charles je izrazito vrijedan - niti je genijalac niti je snažan, jednostavno se trudi više od drugih. Jako mu se sviđa bahata, opaka i seksi detektivka Rosa Diaz (Stephanie Beatriz), ali on kod nje nema ama baš nikakve šanse. A u policijske posle nos neprestano zabada ekscentrična i umišljena tajnica Gina Linetti (Chelsea Peretti).

programme.title: Škola Crna rupa
programme.desc: Pet učenika i njihov nastavnik istražuju paranormalne pojave koje se dešavu u njihovoj školi. Pet učenika i njihov nastavnik istražuju paranormalne pojave koje se dešavu u njihovoj školi.

programme.title: Škorpija
programme.desc: Serija se temelji na istinitoj priči i prati genija Voltera O'Brajena (Elyes Gabel) i njegovog tima sjajnih čudesa koji se bore protiv složenih visokotehnoloških prijetnji modernog vremena. Tim čine:... Serija se temelji na istinitoj priči i prati genija Voltera O'Brajena (Elyes Gabel) i njegovog tima sjajnih čudesa koji se bore protiv složenih visokotehnoloških prijetnji modernog vremena. Tim čine: Tobi Kurtis (Eddie Kaye Thomas), fini bihevioralista; Hapi Kin (Jadyn Wong) vunderkind za mehaniku i Silvester Dod (Ari Stidham), odličan statističar. Iako se međusobno odlično razumiju, vanjski svijet je za njih zagonetka. Srećom, Pejdž Dinin (Katharine McPhee) ima mladog sina koji će ih "prevesti" u vanjski svijet. Svi pobjeđuju s ovim timom: svojom izuzetnom domišljatošću rješavaju nacionalne krize, pomažući sebi da se uklope u stvarni svijet.

credits.actor: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser, January Jones, Christina Hendricks, Michael Gladis, Rosemarie DeWitt, Talia Balsam

programme.title: Sajnfeld
programme.desc: Serija koja je počela kao svaki drugi sitkom, a izrasla u najkompleksnije televizijsko remek delo, krije se iza prezimena jednog stand up komičara. Sajnfeld je kultni naslov iza kojeg stoji devet... Serija koja je počela kao svaki drugi sitkom, a izrasla u najkompleksnije televizijsko remek delo, krije se iza prezimena jednog stand up komičara. Sajnfeld je kultni naslov iza kojeg stoji devet Emija, tri Zlatna globusa i pregršt drugih nagrada, čiji je broj mali u odnosu na višemilionski auditorijum koji je svake nedelje sedeo pred televizijskih ekrana kako bi video šta to njemu večeras na tako smešan i komičan način, smeta. Džeri je komičar koji ima najboljeg prijatelja, bivšu devojku koja mu postaje najbolja prijateljica i komšiju koji mu postaje deo života. Itekako mu ide sa ženama, ali nijedna mu ne odgovara: ili ima veliki nos, ili je prelepa, ali ne baš pod svakim svetlom itd...ali vremenom mu sve to postaje dosadno i odluči da menja svoj život.

credits.actor: Denis Leary, Michael Lombardi, Steven Pasquale, Andrea Roth, John Scurti, Daniel Sunjata, Callie Thorne, Natalie Distler

programme.title: Vrh Jezera
programme.desc: Nestanak trudne djevojčice unosi veliki nemir u stanovnike ostrva i detektivku koja je dobila slučaj... Tui Mitcham, 12-godišnja djevojčica do grla ulazi u ledeno jezero na Južnom ostrvu Novog... Nestanak trudne djevojčice unosi veliki nemir u stanovnike ostrva i detektivku koja je dobila slučaj... Tui Mitcham, 12-godišnja djevojčica do grla ulazi u ledeno jezero na Južnom ostrvu Novog Zelanda. Riječ je o kćerki mjesnog narkobosa, Matta Mitchama i njegove treće žene, saznaje se da je u petom mjesecu trudnoće nakon čega joj se gubi svaki trag. Robin Griffin je neiskusna detektivka koja dobija poziv da istraži Tuin slučaj. Kako raste njezina opsjednutost potragom i broj mještana koje ispituje, tako počinje shvaćati da joj je pronaći Tui jednako važno kao i pronaći samu sebe, sebe koju dobro skriva od očiju javnosti. Tuina priča je u Robinin život vratila dvojicu muškarca iz prošlosti...

programme.title: Opušteno
programme.desc: Reditelj Zander Leman i izvršni producent Džejson Rajtman (reditelj filmova "U vazduhu" i "Džuno") predstavljaju nam komediju "Opušteno", nominovanu za nagradu Zlatni globus, koja istražuje smešnu i... Reditelj Zander Leman i izvršni producent Džejson Rajtman (reditelj filmova "U vazduhu" i "Džuno") predstavljaju nam komediju "Opušteno", nominovanu za nagradu Zlatni globus, koja istražuje smešnu i čudnu dinamiku modernih porodica i odnosa unutar njih. Nedavno razvedena Valerija i njena 16-godišnja ćerka Lora se useljavaju kod Valerijinog brata Aleksa, večitog neženje i stručnjaka za usputne veze. Valerija i Aleks zajedno krstare kroz ludi svet izlazaka usput odgajajući njenu ćerku tinejdžerku.

programme.title: Monk Mali Pas
programme.desc: Monk je veseli mali pas koji uporno daje sve od sebe, ali uvijek pogriješi! Kad stvari krenu po zlu za Monka, slijedi katastrofa jer sve vrlo lako može brzo izmaknuti kontroli. Monk je veseli mali pas koji uporno daje sve od sebe, ali uvijek pogriješi! Kad stvari krenu po zlu za Monka, slijedi katastrofa jer sve vrlo lako može brzo izmaknuti kontroli.

programme.title: Goldbergovi
programme.desc: Jednom ne tako davno i ne tako daleko 11-godišnji Adam Goldberg (Sean Giambrone) video-kamerom svojih roditelja dokumentira život na periferiji 1980-ih godina. Pratimo 3. sezonu humoristične serije za sve uzraste o bučnoj, toploj i pomalo neprilagođenoj obitelji u 80-ima. Pripovjedač nam govori o svojem životu s nametljivom majkom, razdražljivim ocem, buntovnom starijom sestrom, prenapetim starijim bratom i djedom zavodnikom. Goldbergovi su obožavatelji videorekordera, glazbenih kompilacija i elastana! Najmlađi sin Adam (Sean Giambrone), štreber opsjednut filmovima, i dalje se pokušava nositi sa životom školarca te dokumentira urnebesne i neugodne ispade svoje živopisne obitelji. Majka Beverly (Wendi McLendon-Covey) u punoj je formi kad se petlja u tuđe živote, nalazi ljudima partnere i zasljepljuje sve oko sebe, dok tata Murray (Jeff Garlin) odgaja djecu iz udobnog naslonjača na kojem sjedi samo u gaćama. Najstarije dijete Erica (Hayley Orrantia) napokon će se odvojiti od obitelji i otići na fakultet. Barry (Troy Gentile), srednje dijete, obuzet je osjećajima, kao i pisanjem domišljatih stihova te suosjeća s prijateljem Geoffom Schwartzom (Sam Lerner) kad njihove starije djevojke odu studirati. Najstariji je član obitelji omiljeni djed Al Solomon (George Segal), razuzdani član klana, besramni zavodnik koji uživa u trenucima s unucima gotovo jednako kao i u tjednim masažama. U ovoj sezoni djeca će se morati odupirati zagrljajima i pusicama dok pokušavaju odrasti u obitelji Goldberg.

credits.actor: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser, January Jones, Christina Hendricks, Michael Gladis, Rosemarie DeWitt, Talia Balsam

programme.desc: Serija koja je počela kao svaki drugi sitkom, a izrasla u najkompleksnije televizijsko remek delo, krije se iza prezimena jednog stand up komičara. Sajnfeld je kultni naslov iza kojeg stoji devet... Serija koja je počela kao svaki drugi sitkom, a izrasla u najkompleksnije televizijsko remek delo, krije se iza prezimena jednog stand up komičara. Sajnfeld je kultni naslov iza kojeg stoji devet Emija, tri Zlatna globusa i pregršt drugih nagrada, čiji je broj mali u odnosu na višemilionski auditorijum koji je svake nedelje sedeo pred televizijskih ekrana kako bi video šta to njemu večeras na tako smešan i komičan način, smeta. Džeri je komičar koji ima najboljeg prijatelja, bivšu devojku koja mu postaje najbolja prijateljica i komšiju koji mu postaje deo života. Itekako mu ide sa ženama, ali nijedna mu ne odgovara: ili ima veliki nos, ili je prelepa, ali ne baš pod svakim svetlom itd...ali vremenom mu sve to postaje dosadno i odluči da menja svoj život.

credits.actor: Denis Leary, Michael Lombardi, Steven Pasquale, Andrea Roth, John Scurti, Daniel Sunjata, Callie Thorne, Natalie Distler

programme.title: Vrh Jezera
programme.desc: Nestanak trudne djevojčice unosi veliki nemir u stanovnike ostrva i detektivku koja je dobila slučaj... Tui Mitcham, 12-godišnja djevojčica do grla ulazi u ledeno jezero na Južnom ostrvu Novog... Nestanak trudne djevojčice unosi veliki nemir u stanovnike ostrva i detektivku koja je dobila slučaj... Tui Mitcham, 12-godišnja djevojčica do grla ulazi u ledeno jezero na Južnom ostrvu Novog Zelanda. Riječ je o kćerki mjesnog narkobosa, Matta Mitchama i njegove treće žene, saznaje se da je u petom mjesecu trudnoće nakon čega joj se gubi svaki trag. Robin Griffin je neiskusna detektivka koja dobija poziv da istraži Tuin slučaj. Kako raste njezina opsjednutost potragom i broj mještana koje ispituje, tako počinje shvaćati da joj je pronaći Tui jednako važno kao i pronaći samu sebe, sebe koju dobro skriva od očiju javnosti. Tuina priča je u Robinin život vratila dvojicu muškarca iz prošlosti...

programme.title: Opušteno
programme.desc: Reditelj Zander Leman i izvršni producent Džejson Rajtman (reditelj filmova "U vazduhu" i "Džuno") predstavljaju nam komediju "Opušteno", nominovanu za nagradu Zlatni globus, koja istražuje smešnu i... Reditelj Zander Leman i izvršni producent Džejson Rajtman (reditelj filmova "U vazduhu" i "Džuno") predstavljaju nam komediju "Opušteno", nominovanu za nagradu Zlatni globus, koja istražuje smešnu i čudnu dinamiku modernih porodica i odnosa unutar njih. Nedavno razvedena Valerija i njena 16-godišnja ćerka Lora se useljavaju kod Valerijinog brata Aleksa, večitog neženje i stručnjaka za usputne veze. Valerija i Aleks zajedno krstare kroz ludi svet izlazaka usput odgajajući njenu ćerku tinejdžerku.

programme.title: Monk Mali Pas
programme.desc: Monk je veseli mali pas koji uporno daje sve od sebe, ali uvijek pogriješi! Kad stvari krenu po zlu za Monka, slijedi katastrofa jer sve vrlo lako može brzo izmaknuti kontroli. Monk je veseli mali pas koji uporno daje sve od sebe, ali uvijek pogriješi! Kad stvari krenu po zlu za Monka, slijedi katastrofa jer sve vrlo lako može brzo izmaknuti kontroli.

credits.actor: Bob Odenkirk, Rhea Seehorn, Jonathan Banks, Michael McKean, Patrick Fabian, Michael Mando, Julie Ann Emery, Jeremy Shamos

programme.title: Brooklyn 99
programme.desc: Zakon i nered. U njujorškoj policijskoj postaji u Brooklynu svaki dan je poseban, svaki je drugačiji i u pravilu prilično kaotičan. Jake Peralta (Andy Samberg) talentirani je detektiv, zbog čega se nikad nije morao ubijati od posla i slijepo se držati pravila. Budući da je uhitio više zločinaca od kolega, tijekom karijere svi su ga držali kao kap vode na dlanu. Sve dok u postaju nije došao novi zapovjednik, kapetan Ray Holt (Andre Braugher). Kapetan Holt poštuje pravila i propise, koje su detektivi 99. postaje dugo zanemarivali. Jakeovi kolege vrsni su i sposobni detektivi, ali kronično im nedostaje reda i discipline. Međusobno se nadmeću, idu si na živce, tračaju i flertaju, ali u konačnici jedni druge štite. Detektivka Amy Santiago (Melissa Fumero), dežurna čistunka u postaji, oduševljena je novim vodstvom. Budući da je odrasla sa sedmoricom braće, voli se nadmetati u svakom smislu te riječi. Silno želi uhititi više zločinaca od Jakea i svjesna je koliko se mora potruditi da bi u tome uspjela. Holtov zamjenik, narednik Terry Jeffords (Terry Crews), stijena je od čovjeka, no povukao se u ured nakon što mu je žena rodila blizanke Cagney i Lacey, i to zbog silnoga straha da u suprotnome neće vidjeti kako mu kćeri odrastaju. U 99. postaji radi i detektiv Charles Boyle (Joe Lo Truglio), kojem je Jake idol. Charles je izrazito vrijedan - niti je genijalac niti je snažan, jednostavno se trudi više od drugih. Jako mu se sviđa bahata, opaka i seksi detektivka Rosa Diaz (Stephanie Beatriz), ali on kod nje nema ama baš nikakve šanse. A u policijske posle nos neprestano zabada ekscentrična i umišljena tajnica Gina Linetti (Chelsea Peretti).

programme.title: Škola Crna rupa
programme.desc: Pet učenika i njihov nastavnik istražuju paranormalne pojave koje se dešavu u njihovoj školi. Pet učenika i njihov nastavnik istražuju paranormalne pojave koje se dešavu u njihovoj školi.

programme.title: Goldbergovi
programme.desc: Jednom ne tako davno i ne tako daleko 11-godišnji Adam Goldberg (Sean Giambrone) video-kamerom svojih roditelja dokumentira život na periferiji 1980-ih godina. Pratimo 3. sezonu humoristične serije za sve uzraste o bučnoj, toploj i pomalo neprilagođenoj obitelji u 80-ima. Pripovjedač nam govori o svojem životu s nametljivom majkom, razdražljivim ocem, buntovnom starijom sestrom, prenapetim starijim bratom i djedom zavodnikom. Goldbergovi su obožavatelji videorekordera, glazbenih kompilacija i elastana! Najmlađi sin Adam (Sean Giambrone), štreber opsjednut filmovima, i dalje se pokušava nositi sa životom školarca te dokumentira urnebesne i neugodne ispade svoje živopisne obitelji. Majka Beverly (Wendi McLendon-Covey) u punoj je formi kad se petlja u tuđe živote, nalazi ljudima partnere i zasljepljuje sve oko sebe, dok tata Murray (Jeff Garlin) odgaja djecu iz udobnog naslonjača na kojem sjedi samo u gaćama. Najstarije dijete Erica (Hayley Orrantia) napokon će se odvojiti od obitelji i otići na fakultet. Barry (Troy Gentile), srednje dijete, obuzet je osjećajima, kao i pisanjem domišljatih stihova te suosjeća s prijateljem Geoffom Schwartzom (Sam Lerner) kad njihove starije djevojke odu studirati. Najstariji je član obitelji omiljeni djed Al Solomon (George Segal), razuzdani član klana, besramni zavodnik koji uživa u trenucima s unucima gotovo jednako kao i u tjednim masažama. U ovoj sezoni djeca će se morati odupirati zagrljajima i pusicama dok pokušavaju odrasti u obitelji Goldberg.

credits.actor: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser, January Jones, Christina Hendricks, Michael Gladis, Rosemarie DeWitt, Talia Balsam

Najmlađi sin Adam (Sean Giambrone), štreber opsjednut filmovima, i dalje se pokušava nositi sa životom školarca te dokumentira urnebesne i neugodne ispade svoje živopisne obitelji. Majka Beverly (Wendi McLendon-Covey) u punoj je formi kad se petlja u tuđe živote, nalazi ljudima partnere i zasljepljuje sve oko sebe, dok tata Murray (Jeff Garlin) odgaja djecu iz udobnog naslonjača na kojem sjedi samo u gaćama. Najstarije dijete Erica (Hayley Orrantia) napokon će se odvojiti od obitelji i otići na fakultet. Barry (Troy Gentile), srednje dijete, obuzet je osjećajima, kao i pisanjem domišljatih stihova te suosjeća s prijateljem Geoffom Schwartzom (Sam Lerner) kad njihove starije djevojke odu studirati. Najstariji je član obitelji omiljeni djed Al Solomon (George Segal), razuzdani član klana, besramni zavodnik koji uživa u trenucima s unucima gotovo jednako kao i u tjednim masažama. U ovoj sezoni djeca će se morati odupirati zagrljajima i pusicama dok pokušavaju odrasti u obitelji Goldberg.

credits.actor: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser, January Jones, Christina Hendricks, Michael Gladis, Rosemarie DeWitt, Talia Balsam

programme.title: Sajnfeld
programme.desc: Serija koja je počela kao svaki drugi sitkom, a izrasla u najkompleksnije televizijsko remek delo, krije se iza prezimena jednog stand up komičara. Sajnfeld je kultni naslov iza kojeg stoji devet... Serija koja je počela kao svaki drugi sitkom, a izrasla u najkompleksnije televizijsko remek delo, krije se iza prezimena jednog stand up komičara. Sajnfeld je kultni naslov iza kojeg stoji devet Emija, tri Zlatna globusa i pregršt drugih nagrada, čiji je broj mali u odnosu na višemilionski auditorijum koji je svake nedelje sedeo pred televizijskih ekrana kako bi video šta to njemu večeras na tako smešan i komičan način, smeta. Džeri je komičar koji ima najboljeg prijatelja, bivšu devojku koja mu postaje najbolja prijateljica i komšiju koji mu postaje deo života. Itekako mu ide sa ženama, ali nijedna mu ne odgovara: ili ima veliki nos, ili je prelepa, ali ne baš pod svakim svetlom itd...ali vremenom mu sve to postaje dosadno i odluči da menja svoj život.

credits.actor: Denis Leary, Michael Lombardi, Steven Pasquale, Andrea Roth, John Scurti, Daniel Sunjata, Callie Thorne, Natalie Distler

programme.title: Vrh Jezera
programme.desc: Nestanak trudne djevojčice unosi veliki nemir u stanovnike ostrva i detektivku koja je dobila slučaj... Tui Mitcham, 12-godišnja djevojčica do grla ulazi u ledeno jezero na Južnom ostrvu Novog... Nestanak trudne djevojčice unosi veliki nemir u stanovnike ostrva i detektivku koja je dobila slučaj... Tui Mitcham, 12-godišnja djevojčica do grla ulazi u ledeno jezero na Južnom ostrvu Novog Zelanda. Riječ je o kćerki mjesnog narkobosa, Matta Mitchama i njegove treće žene, saznaje se da je u petom mjesecu trudnoće nakon čega joj se gubi svaki trag. Robin Griffin je neiskusna detektivka koja dobija poziv da istraži Tuin slučaj. Kako raste njezina opsjednutost potragom i broj mještana koje ispituje, tako počinje shvaćati da joj je pronaći Tui jednako važno kao i pronaći samu sebe, sebe koju dobro skriva od očiju javnosti. Tuina priča je u Robinin život vratila dvojicu muškarca iz prošlosti...

programme.title: Opušteno
programme.desc: Reditelj Zander Leman i izvršni producent Džejson Rajtman (reditelj filmova "U vazduhu" i "Džuno") predstavljaju nam komediju "Opušteno", nominovanu za nagradu Zlatni globus, koja istražuje smešnu i... Reditelj Zander Leman i izvršni producent Džejson Rajtman (reditelj filmova "U vazduhu" i "Džuno") predstavljaju nam komediju "Opušteno", nominovanu za nagradu Zlatni globus, koja istražuje smešnu i čudnu dinamiku modernih porodica i odnosa unutar njih. Nedavno razvedena Valerija i njena 16-godišnja ćerka Lora se useljavaju kod Valerijinog brata Aleksa, večitog neženje i stručnjaka za usputne veze. Valerija i Aleks zajedno krstare kroz ludi svet izlazaka usput odgajajući njenu ćerku tinejdžerku.

programme.title: Monk Mali Pas
programme.desc: Monk je veseli mali pas koji uporno daje sve od sebe, ali uvijek pogriješi! Kad stvari krenu po zlu za Monka, slijedi katastrofa jer sve vrlo lako može brzo izmaknuti kontroli. Monk je veseli mali pas koji uporno daje sve od sebe, ali uvijek pogriješi! Kad stvari krenu po zlu za Monka, slijedi katastrofa jer sve vrlo lako može brzo izmaknuti kontroli.

credits.actor: Bob Odenkirk, Rhea Seehorn, Jonathan Banks, Michael McKean, Patrick Fabian, Michael Mando, Julie Ann Emery, Jeremy Shamos

programme.title: Brooklyn 99
programme.desc: Zakon i nered. U njujorškoj policijskoj postaji u Brooklynu svaki dan je poseban, svaki je drugačiji i u pravilu prilično kaotičan. Jake Peralta (Andy Samberg) talentirani je detektiv, zbog čega se nikad nije morao ubijati od posla i slijepo se držati pravila. Budući da je uhitio više zločinaca od kolega, tijekom karijere svi su ga držali kao kap vode na dlanu. Sve dok u postaju nije došao novi zapovjednik, kapetan Ray Holt (Andre Braugher). Kapetan Holt poštuje pravila i propise, koje su detektivi 99. postaje dugo zanemarivali. Jakeovi kolege vrsni su i sposobni detektivi, ali kronično im nedostaje reda i discipline. Međusobno se nadmeću, idu si na živce, tračaju i flertaju, ali u konačnici jedni druge štite. Detektivka Amy Santiago (Melissa Fumero), dežurna čistunka u postaji, oduševljena je novim vodstvom. Budući da je odrasla sa sedmoricom braće, voli se nadmetati u svakom smislu te riječi. Silno želi uhititi više zločinaca od Jakea i svjesna je koliko se mora potruditi da bi u tome uspjela. Holtov zamjenik, narednik Terry Jeffords (Terry Crews), stijena je od čovjeka, no povukao se u ured nakon što mu je žena rodila blizanke Cagney i Lacey, i to zbog silnoga straha da u suprotnome neće vidjeti kako mu kćeri odrastaju. U 99. postaji radi i detektiv Charles Boyle (Joe Lo Truglio), kojem je Jake idol. Charles je izrazito vrijedan - niti je genijalac niti je snažan, jednostavno se trudi više od drugih. Jako mu se sviđa bahata, opaka i seksi detektivka Rosa Diaz (Stephanie Beatriz), ali on kod nje nema ama baš nikakve šanse. A u policijske posle nos neprestano zabada ekscentrična i umišljena tajnica Gina Linetti (Chelsea Peretti).

programme.title: Škola Crna rupa
programme.desc: Pet učenika i njihov nastavnik istražuju paranormalne pojave koje se dešavu u njihovoj školi. Pet učenika i njihov nastavnik istražuju paranormalne pojave koje se dešavu u njihovoj školi.

programme.title: Goldbergovi
programme.desc: Jednom ne tako davno i ne tako daleko 11-godišnji Adam Goldberg (Sean Giambrone) video-kamerom svojih roditelja dokumentira život na periferiji 1980-ih godina. Pratimo 3. sezonu humoristične serije za sve uzraste o bučnoj, toploj i pomalo neprilagođenoj obitelji u 80-ima. Pripovjedač nam govori o svojem životu s nametljivom majkom, razdražljivim ocem, buntovnom starijom sestrom, prenapetim starijim bratom i djedom zavodnikom. Goldbergovi su obožavatelji videorekordera, glazbenih kompilacija i elastana! Najmlađi sin Adam (Sean Giambrone), štreber opsjednut filmovima, i dalje se pokušava nositi sa životom školarca te dokumentira urnebesne i neugodne ispade svoje živopisne obitelji. Majka Beverly (Wendi McLendon-Covey) u punoj je formi kad se petlja u tuđe živote, nalazi ljudima partnere i zasljepljuje sve oko sebe, dok tata Murray (Jeff Garlin) odgaja djecu iz udobnog naslonjača na kojem sjedi samo u gaćama. Najstarije dijete Erica (Hayley Orrantia) napokon će se odvojiti od obitelji i otići na fakultet. Barry (Troy Gentile), srednje dijete, obuzet je osjećajima, kao i pisanjem domišljatih stihova te suosjeća s prijateljem Geoffom Schwartzom (Sam Lerner) kad njihove starije djevojke odu studirati. Najstariji je član obitelji omiljeni djed Al Solomon (George Segal), razuzdani član klana, besramni zavodnik koji uživa u trenucima s unucima gotovo jednako kao i u tjednim masažama. U ovoj sezoni djeca će se morati odupirati zagrljajima i pusicama dok pokušavaju odrasti u obitelji Goldberg.

credits.actor: Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, Vincent Kartheiser, January Jones, Christina Hendricks, Michael Gladis, Rosemarie DeWitt, Talia Balsam
